channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Perhaps the most enlightened Perl team in London
item.description: Itâ€™s no secret that I used to run a Perl team myself in Central London, and was competing for talent with the other teams. By far the hardest team to compete with was the one whose technical leader was making sure his team were always using the best tools..

item.title: Two Things that Make Developers Happy - Mid-to-Senior Perl Developer in London
item.description: Not everyoneâ€™s like me. Perhaps nobodyâ€™s like me. But when it comes to enjoying programming jobs, and particularly when it comes to enjoying Perl programming jobs, there are two things that are needed to make me happy that I suspect resonate with most other career developers.

item.title: Lights, Camera ... Perl! - Mid-Level Perl / Ops for the movies (London UK)
item.description: Thereâ€™s Bad CGI, and thereâ€™s Good CGI. Bad CGI involves your web-server standing up new perl processes for incoming requests, where Good CGI makes the films you watch magical. This job â€“ unusually for Perl â€“ involves Good CGI.

item.title: Book Review: Scaling Teams
item.description: A review of O'Reilly's book "Scaling Teams". Pat regularly talks on being a tech leader, and has a lot of experience helping development teams. I'll be adding it to my wishlist.

item.title: Dave Mitchell's grant report for May
item.description: Dave's biggest piece of work in May was reworking the sprintf implementation, in the process fixing bugs and making it faster.

item.title: The Community Advocacy Committee has a new chair person
item.description: Mark Prather has volunteered to be the chairman of the TPF community advocacy committee. He has some ideas, but is looking for more fresh blood, if you want to join the committee.

item.title: Grant Report : Robust Perl 6 Unicode Support
item.description: A progress report from Samantha on her project to support the robustness of Unicode support in Rakudo. This work is supported by a TPF grant.

item.title: COMPLETION Report / Perl 6 IO TPF Grant
item.description: Zoffix has completed his work on standardisation, test coverage, and documentation of Perl 6 I/O routines, which was supported by a grant. Read about what he did.

item.title: Grant Proposal: Revitalize blogs.perl.org
item.description: AndrÃ© has applied for a grant of $3k to have a go at providing a replacement for blogs.perl.org. If you have any thoughts on this, please add comments at the foot of the post.

item.title: Infinity Interactive's TPC 2017 app
item.description: John Anderson and Jay Hannah, who both work for Infinity Interactive, are giving talks at TPC. Infinity are not only a sponsor of the conference, they've developed the conference app for Android and iOS, which you can use to get the most out of your time at TPC. Nice one Infinity!

item.title: The Perl Conference Newsletter
item.description: Information about the Perl Conference, which kicks off next Sunday (18th June) with tutorials from the superband of Anderson, Rolsky, Signes, and Schwartz. If you're going, why not give a lightning talk?

item.title: Improve your test logs with simple distro diagnostics
Blog engine in Perl 6
item.description: Gabor is working on a blogging engine in Perl 6, as one of the examples for his book on web application development in Perl 6.

item.title: 2017.23 Fulfilled TAP
item.description: The weekly roundup of Perl 6 news.

item.title: Perl 6 Books Landscape in June 2017
item.description: Moritz summarises the Perl 6 books that are available now, or in development.

item.title: Sorting out synchronous I/O
item.description: Jonathan describes some work he did to fix a longstanding I/O bug in MoarVM, funded by Nick Logan.

item.title: Perl::Critic 1.128 fixes bugs and works with Perl 5.26
item.description: Perl::Critic, the static code analysis tool for Perl.

item.title: GitPrep 2.6
item.description: Kimoto-san has released a new version of his Github replacement, GitPrep, which adds wiki support.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: May 23rd to June 5th
item.description: The main news for that week was that Perl 5.26 is now available. Some other stuff went on as well.

item.title: Add Structured Data to Log::Any
item.description: Philipp has submitted a pull request to Log::Any, to add support for passing structured data. If you use Log::Any, take a look!

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: #307 - The Perl Conference is nearly upon us
item.description:
The Perl conference is nearly upon us, so we have several related posts. If you're going, get the app from Infinity Interactive on your phone!

If you want to see a book on web application development in Perl 6, you could support Gabor's crowdfunding campaign.

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
